intro: Houstonia purpurea var. purpurea, commonly known as purple bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically a shade of purple, ranging from pale lavender to deep violet. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Its low-growing habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for native gardens and ecological restoration projects.
